definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Team A would score and then immediately retreat to its own end of the court.
sentences.chinese: A隊得分後立馬回撤到後場。

sentences.english: Some people will text message friends or watch videos on the internet.
sentences.chinese: 有些人立馬給朋友發短信或是在線看片。

sentences.english: They must have thought they were going to get in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 她們立馬四散而逃，她們肯定以爲自己闖了什麼大禍。
小孩的母親立馬僵住了。

sentences.english: Yeluu galloped his horse up a hillock; stopped at the top; and surveyed the field, enjoying with great pride.
sentences.chinese: 耶律洪基縱馬上了一座小丘，立馬丘頂，顧盼自豪。

sentences.english: When a healthy rat smells a cat, it flees.
sentences.chinese: 當一隻健康的老鼠聞到貓的味道時，立馬溜之大吉。

sentences.english: Nichkhun immediately refused, "There's no need to know."
sentences.chinese: 尼坤立馬就拒絕了，“沒有必要知道啦。

sentences.english: And you don't all have to go stampeding down to my office right away.
sentences.chinese: 你們並不需要都，立馬來到我的辦公室。

sentences.english: After questioning him,they let him go  temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 在詢問他之後，立馬就讓他離開了。

sentences.english: If you suspect you have diabetes, it is good to do a check-up soon.
sentences.chinese: 如果你懷疑你有糖尿病了，最好立馬做個檢查。

sentences.english: a huge and unusual crystal chandelier will immediately catch your eye.
sentences.chinese: 一個與衆不同的巨型水晶吊燈立馬就映入你的眼簾。

sentences.english: Jack stopped immediately and took one step backward, back into the shadow of the corner.
sentences.chinese: 傑克立馬停住並後退一步回到暗角里。

sentences.english: At this revelation, I started sobbing hysterically, my face turning bright red.
sentences.chinese: 聽他這麼一說，我立馬泣不成聲，臉也漲得通紅。

sentences.english: Grandpa finally woke up, jingjing immediately began to cry.
sentences.chinese: 外公終於醒了過來，晶晶立馬開始裝哭起來。

sentences.english: When we mentioned Mr. Chern, he responded immediately, "Mr."
sentences.chinese: 我們跟他說起陳先生，他立馬接過話說，陳省身？

sentences.english: Sir Walter promptly boxed his son's ears.
sentences.chinese: 老沃特聞言七竅生煙，立馬甩了他兒子一個耳光。

definition: at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
